document_title: Prolonged insomnia: Causes, symptoms, treatments, harms
subsection_content:
Prolonged insomnia (English name is insomnia) is a sleep disorder that causes patients to experience health problems, decreased mental health and increased the risk of many different diseases related to the nerves and heart. circuit.
According to the American Academy of Sleep Medicine, an estimated 10% of adults have long-term insomnia and 15-35% of adults have acute insomnia that lasts for a few days, weeks, or even up to a year. up to 3 months. In fact, insomnia can happen to anyone, at any age. (first)
More and more people suffer from prolonged insomnia
